data.title: Replay controls
data.body:
It would be a great asset if it were possible to pause/play replays as well as rewind, fast forward and otherwise scrub through them. 

It would help out video content creators in being able to set up for recording, highlight a particular moment in a game, or even do proper long-form analysis of games by moving around the time line at will.

data.title: Updated to GeoIP2
data.body:
I not only modernized the API used and refreshed the GeoIP database, but also reduced the IO load by parsing the file only once as suggested by https://github.com/maxmind/GeoIP2-dotnet#database-usage which will a nice performance win with the current up to 100 games on the server list now that we are popular. Also added some try/catch for unforeseeable problems like https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4601

Tip: Run with `Debug.IgnoreVersionMismatch=true` to see all games in the server browser.

The update to .NET 4.0 was required, because everything below is unsupported by the dependencies. Fetched the DLLs from https://www.nuget.org/packages/MaxMind.GeoIP2/

data.title: Bridge explosions sometimes kill Tanya after she C4s them
data.body:
This is because she goes and stands on the bridge after she plants the explosives. Reproducible at the central bridge on the Equal Opportunity ra map.

data.title: Added a spectator player that shares shroud with everyone
data.body: I experimented a bit and figured that the easiest solution to #4607 is to add a new non combat player that is allied with every player therefore gaining shared shroud view.

Implement menu buttons for unit stance control
data.body:
Unit stances can be changed by pressing z key but it would be better if there were buttons below the production menu for example to control the stance of units with mouse clicks.

Issue #3437 is relevant.

data.title: RMBO can C4 chain link barriers
data.body: As the title states you can C4 chain link barriers with the Commando, this may also be the case for sandbags and concrete walls although i haven't tested that. The chain link fences also just disappears with no explosion or anything when C4ed.

data.title: Make it possible to assign sounds to sequences
data.body:
As title says, make it possible to assign a sound (or multiple randomly chosen sounds) to a sequence. This could replace specific stuff like ImpactSound and WaterImpactSound, and make it easier to implement #4644 properly, for example.

It would also nicely complement #3692.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1411311-make-it-possible-to-assign-sounds-to-sequences?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Explosion setup is too limited
data.body:
I think the current explosion system is a little unintuitive and limited.

1) First of all, it doesn't cover two special cases of the original RA1:
- If a vessel was hit directly (impact close enough to center), the warheads' regular explosion was used instead of a splash anim.
- If an air unit was hit, FLAK.SHP was used instead of the regular explosion anim of that warhead.

2) I don't like that a 2nd trait is needed on weapons to enable water explosions, and it would only get more complicated if point 1) was implemented the same way.

3) Furthermore, in my opinion it is a little unintuitive that all explosions are defined as sequences of 'explosion:' instead of as regular animations.

What I'd suggest to take care of all 3 points:
Explosions should no longer be defined as sequences of explosion:, but rather like normal animations, with ground, water, air, ground-target, water-target, air-target sequences.

Example:

Weapon:
(...)
    Explosion: med_explosion
(...)

in sequences.yaml

med_explosion:
- ground: frag1
-         Start: 0
-         Length: *
-    water: h2o_exp2
-         Start: 0
-         Length: *
-    air: veh-hit1
-         Start: 0
-         Length: *
-    ground-target: frag1
-         Start: 0
-         Length: *
-    water-target-target: frag1
-         Start: 0
-         Length: *
-    air-target: flak
-         Start: 0
-         Length: *

data.title: Unit tooltips in the build menu should show stats.
data.body: Stats such as health,damage at specific units,etc

data.title: Units give up entering an impassible transport.
data.body:
Units will give up attempting to enter the transport if they are adjacent but unable to enter (e.g. helicopter is in the air). The enter transport order needs to continue queuing MoveAdjacentTo orders until it succeeds.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1410825-units-give-up-entering-an-impassible-transport?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: RA naval transport should only open its doors when it stops moving
data.body: This can be done by adding a IMove.IsMoving check in RenderLandingCraft.ShouldBeOpen, but Mobile.IsMoving seems to have a bug that causes it to briefly set false when it completes each cell step.

data.body: They should Drag instead.
